alpinesRockeries.name: double snowdrop - in the green
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Plant pots in naturalistic drifts 10cm (4in) on arrival. Where pots of bulbs are planted in grass do not cut the grass until after the leaves have died back.

alpinesRockeries.name: primrose
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Divide large clumps after the plant has  flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: Saxifraga Alpino Early Picotee
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun with a little shade during the hottest part of  the day
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: freely draining in winter, but able to hold some moisture  during the warmer months
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: cyclamen bulb (syn. Neapolitanum)
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun to partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  humus-rich, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: While in bloom, keep the root ball moist and feed the plant every two weeks. Cyclamen should be kept moist by watering in a tray and allowing the roots to take up the water rather than watering from above the plant which can lead to rotting. Remove yellow leaves and spent flowers.

alpinesRockeries.name: wood anemone
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, humus-rich soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Leave undisturbed and they will spread to form large drifts. Avoid excessive winter wet and apply a generous layer of mulch in autumn.

alpinesRockeries.name: Saxifraga  Alpino Pink
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun with a little shade during the hottest part of  the day
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: freely draining in winter, but able to hold some moisture  during the warmer months
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: pink seathrift
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Sea thrift grows best in full sun in lean, very well-drained soil. The plants are drought tolerant and do not tolerate moist soils. They frequently rot in the center, killing the entire plant, in heavy clay, soils that are too fertile, or after a prolonged wet and cool fall.

alpinesRockeries.name: wood anemone
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, humus-rich soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Leave undisturbed and they will spread to form large drifts. Avoid excessive winter wet and apply a generous layer of mulch in autumn.

alpinesRockeries.name: mountain rock cress
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and  to keep the plants looking bushy, cut them back hard immediately after  flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: house leek ( chick charms series houseleek )
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor to moderately fertile, well-drained soil with added grit
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth:
Hardiness:  fully hardy

These decorative evergreen groundcovering plants can be used to great effect in troughs, alpine beds, stone walls and even to soften the gaps between paving slabs.
alpinesRockeries.flowering: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: cotton lavender
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  poor to moderately-fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Remove the faded flower-heads along with any straggly shoots in autumn. In early-spring cut back the flowered shoots to within 2.5cm (1in) of the old growth.

alpinesRockeries.name: house leek ( chick charms series houseleek )
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor to moderately fertile, well-drained soil with added grit
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: orchid bulb
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  orchid compost or freely draining soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  The bulbs should be gently bedded in to the top of the compost, making sure that at least two thirds of the bulb is sitting above the compost. Ideally they should be spaced at 10 - 15cm intervals, or if potting up, allow three per 15cm diameter pot. They are not hardy so they will need winter protection. Ideally they should be grown in a pot and keep in a cool greenhouse or conservatory and kept dry over winter.

alpinesRockeries.name: geranium
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth:  average to fast growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Carefully weed by hand as hoeing can break rhizomes, which are very close to the surface. Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: aubrieta Audrey Purple
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained, preferably neutral or alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and  to keep the plants looking bushy, cut them back hard immediately after  flowering. This may also encourage a second, less prolific, flush of   flowers.

alpinesRockeries.name: bellflower
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Protect the tender foliage from slug damage using environmentally friendly slug pellets or beer traps. During the growing season water freely and deadhead with scissors to prolong flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: shruby veronica (syn. Hebe Carl Teschner )
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor or moderately fertile, moist, well-drained neutral to slightly alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Needs minimal pruning. Remove misplaced or frost damaged branches in late spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: navelwort
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  moist, moderately fertile, humus-rich soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Incorporate lots of well-rotted leafmould, composted pine needles or garden compost when planting. Lift and divide congested colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: grape hyacinth 'Peppermint'
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care:
Bulb size: 7/8

Small ice-blue flowers, each with a fine white lip, form in conical spikes  that rise above the slender foliage in mid-spring. It looks wonderful when  allowed to form generous swathes, particularly in a woodland or meadow-style  setting, - and it also looks very sweet in patio pots,  windowboxes or alpine beds.

alpinesRockeries.name: bellflower
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Protect the tender foliage from slug damage using environmentally friendly slug pellets or beer traps.  During the growing season water freely and headhead with scissors to prolong flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: sowbread
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately-fertile, humus-rich, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Apply a generous 5-7cm (2-3in) mulch of well-rotted leaf mould around the crown of the plants in spring as the foliage starts to die back.

alpinesRockeries.name: wild bleeding heart
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus-rich, preferably  neutral to slightly alkaline
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Dicentras are happy in any good garden soil that is fertile but not too heavy.  Enrich the soil with plenty of leaf mould before planting and apply a mulch in autumn, too. A light fertilising in March will help enormously.

alpinesRockeries.name: pink
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:

alpinesRockeries.name: house leeks / houseleeks collection
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor to moderately fertile, well-drained soil with added grit
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: grape hyacinth
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained soil

alpinesRockeries.name: house leek ( chick charms series houseleek )
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor to moderately fertile, well-drained soil with added grit
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: pasque flower
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Plant very firmly in well-drained soil and take care when carrying out routine border maintenance since Pasque flowers resent having their roots disturbed.

alpinesRockeries.name: rhododendron Inkarho group
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, well-drained, humus-rich, neutral to acidic soil or ericaceous compost
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Apply a  generous 5-7cm mulch of leaf mould around the base of the plant each spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: storksbill - syn Bishops Form
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: gritty, humus-rich, sharply-drained, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Divide congested colonies in spring and avoid  wet soils - particularly in winter.

alpinesRockeries.name: thyme / Thymus serpyllum 'Pink Chintz'
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  well-drained neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  After flowering cut back hard using garden shears to retain a neat compact shape. Lift and divide large clumps in early spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: violet (syn. Viola Boughton Blue)
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, humus-rich, moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould or garden compost  when planting. Protect young plants from slug-damage using environmentally friendly slug pellets or beer traps. Deadhead the spent blooms to prolong flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: Saxifraga Alpino Red
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun with a little shade during the hottest part of  the day
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: freely draining in winter, but able to hold some moisture  during the warmer months
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: pink seathrift  (syn Armeria Dusseldorf Pride )
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, neutral to alkaline soil

alpinesRockeries.name: bugle
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  any moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: To rejuvenate and minimise congestion, lift and divide clumps in late autumn or early spring every two years.

alpinesRockeries.name: snowdrop bulbs
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately-fertile, moist but well-drained alkaline to neutral soil.  Snowdrops dislike acid soils.
alpinesRockeries.flowering: Flowering period: an early flowering form, January into February

alpinesRockeries.name: auricula
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil

alpinesRockeries.name: auricula
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Divide large clumps after the plant has flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: winter aconite - in the green
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, humus-rich, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth:  average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Plant pots in naturalistic drifts 10cm (4in) on arrival.

alpinesRockeries.name: sedum
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained, neutral to slightly alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: Mexican fleablane (syn. Profusion )
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Trouble free. Avoid excessive winter wet and trim lanky stems in autumn.

alpinesRockeries.name: bugle
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:    full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  any moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Sow thinly in a lidded propagator, just covering the seed with a sprinkling of compost before placing in a greenhouse or conservatory. Germination can be a little slow (usually within a month), but for best results keep the soil moist but not waterlogged at temperatures between 10 and 16ï¿½C. Prick out when large enough to handle and grow on in small pots before planting out in summer. Protect the young plants from slugs and snails and avoid overhead watering while still in the seedling stage.

alpinesRockeries.name: cowslip
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Generally, problem-free but do ensure that the ground remains moist, especially where the plant is growing in full sun.

alpinesRockeries.name: ice plant
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, sandy
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid overwatering - particularly in winter.

alpinesRockeries.name: lady's mantle
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:    full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  humus-rich soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back the faded flower heads and foliage in August and the plant will often produce a second flush of flowers. Alchemilla has a tendency to self-seedfreely, so to minimise the spread  of the plant remove the seedheads carefully after flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: sowbread
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately-fertile, humus-rich, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Apply a generous 5-7cm (2-3in) mulch of well-rotted leaf mould around the crown of the plants in spring as the foliage starts to die back.

alpinesRockeries.name: rhodohypoxis
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well drained, moderately fertile, neutral to slightly acidic soil, or equal parts ericaceous compost, leaf mould and sharp sand if grown in a pot
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:Avoid excessive moisture during the winter months, but water freely during summer. They will also benefit from a monthly feed using a general purpose, liquid fertiliser.

alpinesRockeries.name: lady's mantle
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  moderately fertile, humus-rich
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth:  average to fast growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Cut back the faded flower heads and foliage in August and the plant will often produce a second flush of flowers. Alchemilla has a tendency to self-seed freely, so to minimise the spread of the plant, remove the seedheads carefully after flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: Geranium collection
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth:  average to fast growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Carefully weed by hand as hoeing can break rhizomes, which are very close to the surface. Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: hepatica
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, moist but well-drained neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Hepaticas resent being moved, so try to plant them where they can remain undisturbed for several years. Apply a generous layer of mulch in autumn or immediately after flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: himalayan blue poppy
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus rich, moist, well drained, neutral to slightly acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Stake with bamboo canes or brushwood  before the flowers appear. Deadhead regularly to prolong flowering.  Apply a generous 5-7cm (2-3in) mulch of bark chippings, well-rotted  leaf mould or composted pine needles around the base of the plant in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: auricula (Syn Lucky Locket)
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Divide large clumps after the plant has flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: creeping phlox
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or lightly dappled shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, moist but freely draining soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Give it a trim after the flowers have faded and  lift and divide clumps in autumn.

alpinesRockeries.name: partridge berry / checkerberry
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  acid to neutral, peaty, moist soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  When planting, add plenty of well-rotted leaf mould or shredded bark to the planting hole. After flowering light prune or cut back those shoots that spoil the symmetry of the plant. Remove suckers to help restrict growth.

alpinesRockeries.name: candelabra primula
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Divide large clumps after the plant has flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: winter heath
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained acid soil.  Will tolerate mildly alkaline soil.
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: During the growing season water regularly, applying a half-strength application of a balanced liquid fertiliser every four weeks. After the plant has flowered trim with shears or secateurs to remove the dead flowers and encourage bushy growth.

alpinesRockeries.name: creeping phlox
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or lightly dappled shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, moist but freely draining soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Give it a trim after the flowers have faded and  lift and divide clumps in autumn.

alpinesRockeries.name: Vial's primrose / orchid primrose
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Divide large clumps after the plant has  flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: primrose
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Divide large clumps after the plant has   flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: rock rose
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden Care:  Prune in mid to late summer after flowering,  cutting back any straggly stems.

alpinesRockeries.name: woolly rock rose
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately-fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: After flowering, pinch back young plant to encourage a bushy habit. Lightly trim or cut back any stems that spoil the symmetry of the plant. This plant should never be pruned hard. Avoid transplanting or  root disturbance once established.

alpinesRockeries.name: winter aconite bulbs
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, humus-rich, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth:  average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care:
Bulb size: 4/5

Carpets of bright yellow, buttercup-like flowers in late January and February surrounded by ruffs of fresh green leaves. Winter aconites originate from damp woodland and shady places in Eurasia so are perfect for naturalising under deciduous shrubs and trees. They are a welcome sight in late winter as they are one of the first things into flower in the garden.

alpinesRockeries.name: aubrieta  Audrey Sky Blue
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained, preferably neutral or alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and  to keep the plants looking bushy, cut them back hard immediately after  flowering. This may also encourage a second, less prolific, flush of   flowers.

alpinesRockeries.name: pasque flower
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  fertile, well-drained soil (or equal parts of a loam-based potting compost such as John Innes No1 and grit for container-grown specimens)
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Plant very firmly in well-drained soil and take care when carrying out routine border maintenance since Pasque flowers resent having their roots disturbed.

alpinesRockeries.name: orchid
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  orchid compost or freely draining soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: The bulbs should be gently bedded in to the top of the compost, making sure that at least two thirds of the bulb is sitting above the compost. Ideally they should be spaced at 10 - 15cm intervals, or if potting up, allow three per 15cm diameter pot. They are not fully hardy so they will need winter protection. Ideally they should be grown in a pot and keep in a cool greenhouse or conservatory and kept dry over winter.

alpinesRockeries.name: winter heath
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: preferably well-drained acidic soil, however they will tolerate mildly alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: During the growing season water regularly, applying a half-strength application of a balanced liquid fertiliser every four weeks. After the plant has flowered trim with shears or secateurs to remove the dead flowers and encourage bushy growth.

alpinesRockeries.name: geranium
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Carefully weed by hand as hoeing can break rhizomes, which are very close to the surface. Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: bellflower
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, well-drained, fertile soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Protect the tender foliage from slug damage using environmentally friendly slug pellets or beer traps. During the growing season water freely.

alpinesRockeries.name: house leek ( chick charms series houseleek )
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor to moderately fertile, well-drained soil with added grit
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: cyclamineus daffodil bulbs
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Wearing gloves plant bulbs 10cm deep and 10cm apart in autumn. After flowering feed with a balanced fertiliser, dead-head the flowers, but do not be tempted to cut back or tidy the foliage after flowering as this will interfere with the bulbs ability to store energy for the following year's flowers.

alpinesRockeries.name: house leek ( chick charms series houseleek )
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor to moderately fertile, well-drained soil with added grit
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted manure or garden compost into the planting hole. Apply a balanced fertiliser in spring and deadhead to prolong flowering.

alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted manure or garden compost into the planting hole. Apply a balanced fertiliser in spring and deadhead regularly to prolong flowering.

alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: In midsummer rejuvenate plants that  are beginning to look jaded, by removing old flowered stems and leaves. Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: sahuc rock rose (syn Cistus sahucii)
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately-fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: After flowering, pinch back young plant to encourage a bushy habit. Lightly trim or cut back any stems that spoil the symmetry of the plant. This plant should never be pruned hard.

alpinesRockeries.name: sowbread  (syn. Cyclamen neapolitanum )
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun to partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  humus-rich, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Plant shallowly in humus-rich, fertile soil. Apply a mulch of well-rotted leafmould around the crown of the plants in spring as the foliage starts to die back.

alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:

alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and  to keep the plants looking bushy, cut them back hard immediately after  flowering. This may also encourage a second, less prolific, flush of   flowers.

alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.flowering: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and   flowering. This may also encourage a second, less prolific, flush of
alpinesRockeries.care: Hardiness: fully hardy

alpinesRockeries.name: avens
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: To prolong flowering, deadhead regularly. Lift and divide large clumps in early spring or late autumn.

alpinesRockeries.name: wood anemone bulbs
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, humus-rich soil
alpinesRockeries.care:
Bulb Size: 5/7

In spring, large white daisy-like flowers (to 4cm across) emerge above the attractively lobed, dark green foliage. Each petal has a pink flushed reverse and they all sit around a boss of yellow stamens. Wood anemones are ideal for underplanting shrubs or trees.

alpinesRockeries.name: perennial phlox
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, fertile, moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Add lots of leaf-mould or composted pine needles to the soil when planting. Lift and divide large clumps in autumn or spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: bugle
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:    full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  any moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: To rejuvenate and minimise congestion, lift and divide clumps in late autumn or early spring every two years.

alpinesRockeries.name: ice plant
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, sandy
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid overwatering - particularly in winter.

alpinesRockeries.name: partridge berry / checkerberry
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  acid to neutral, peaty, moist soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  When planting, add plenty of well-rotted leaf mould or shredded bark to the planting hole. After flowering light prune or cut back those shoots that spoil the symmetry of the plant. Remove suckers to help restrict growth.

alpinesRockeries.name: Aubrieta Audrey Light Blue
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained, preferably neutral or alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and  to keep the plants looking bushy, cut them back hard immediately after  flowering. This may also encourage a second, less prolific, flush of   flowers.

alpinesRockeries.name: oxslip
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Generally, problem-free but do ensure that the ground does not get too dry, especially where the plant is growing in full sun.

alpinesRockeries.name: shrubby veronica
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor or moderately fertile, moist, well-drained neutral to slightly alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Needs minimal pruning. Remove misplaced or frost damaged branches in late spring

alpinesRockeries.name: hepatica
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, moist but well-drained neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Hepaticas resent being moved, so try to plant them where they can remain undisturbed for several years. Apply a generous layer of mulch in autumn or immediately after flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: auricula
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Divide large clumps after the plant has flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: ice plant
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, sandy
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid overwatering - particularly in winter.

alpinesRockeries.name: showy Chinese gentian
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun to partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  humus rich, reliably moist, but well drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: In areas where the summers are hot and dry, they will need protection from the sun during the hottest part of the day.

alpinesRockeries.name: heartsease / Viola 'Tricolor'
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: any well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Early sowings can be done in a cold frame, into trays of good seed compost and gradually hardened off before planting out. Alternatively sow directly into a well-prepared seed bed. Gently thin the seedlings out to 15cm apart when they are large enough to handle.

alpinesRockeries.name: bugle
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  any moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: To rejuvenate and minimise congestion   lift and divide clumps in late autumn or early spring every two years

alpinesRockeries.name: Saxifraga Alpino Early Lime
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun with a little shade during the hottest part of  the day
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: freely draining in winter, but able to hold some moisture  during the warmer months
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: pasque flower
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  fertile, well-drained soil (or equal parts of a loam-based potting compost such as John Innes No1 and grit for container-grown specimens)
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Plant very firmly in well-drained soil and take care when carrying out routine border maintenance since Pasque flowers resent having their roots disturbed.

alpinesRockeries.name: XL Landscaping pack of bulbs
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, moist but well drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care:
Bulb size: 4/5

It's hard not to love these wonderful bulbs for adding colour to the garden when little else is awake. The nodding white flowers have a small green marking on the inside of each tepal, are honey scented, and appear in late winter. They look particularly good planted in large drifts in grass where they will naturalise quite happily. Alternatively plant them up in clumps in the front of mixed borders, or into pots so they can be admired close up. Plant the bulbs as soon as possible after delivery to prevent the bulbs drying out.

alpinesRockeries.name: navelwort
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  moist, moderately fertile, humus-rich soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Incorporate lots of well-rotted leafmould, composted pine needles or garden compost when planting. Lift and divide congested colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: sowbread
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  humus-rich, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Plant shallowly in humus-rich, fertile soil. Apply a mulch of well-rotted leafmould around the crown of the plants in spring as the foliage starts to die back.

alpinesRockeries.name: striped bloody cranesbill
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: In autumn, rejuvenate plants that are beginning to look jaded by removing old flowered stems and leaves.  Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: beach aster
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Cut back to ground level  in autumn and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: aubrieta Axcent Burgundy
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained, preferably neutral or alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and  to keep the plants looking bushy, cut them back hard immediately after  flowering. This may also encourage a second, less prolific, flush of   flowers.

alpinesRockeries.name: ice plant
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, sandy
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid overwatering - particularly in winter.

alpinesRockeries.name: bellflower
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Protect the tender foliage from slug damage using environmentally friendly slug pellets or beer traps. During the growing season water freely and deadhead with scissors to prolong flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: geranium
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth:  average to fast growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Carefully weed by hand as hoeing can break rhizomes, which are very close to the surface. Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: grape hyacinth collection
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained soil (for container-grown bulbs use two parts John Innes No2 compost to one part sharp grit)
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Plant 10cm (4in) deep in naturalistic groups in autumn. During summer when the bulbs are dormant lift and divide groups that are becoming congested.

alpinesRockeries.name: snowdrop - in the green
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, moisture-retentive soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Plant in naturalistic drifts when they arrive.  Where bulbs are planted in grass do not cut the grass until after the leaves have died back. Divide large colonies immediately after flowering while the leaves are still green.

alpinesRockeries.name: pink
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted manure or garden compost into the planting hole. Apply a balanced fertiliser in spring and deadhead to prolong flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: pink
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted manure or garden compost into the planting hole. Apply a balanced fertiliser in spring and deadhead to prolong flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: dwarf rhododendron
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, well-drained, humus-rich,   acid soil or ericaceous compost
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Avoid planting too deeply and apply a   generous mulch of leaf mould around the base  of the plant each spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: candytuft
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: poor to moderately fertile, moist but well-drained neutral to alkaline soil

alpinesRockeries.name: Mexican fleabane (syn. Profusion )
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Trouble free. Avoid excessive winter wet and trim lanky stems in autumn.

alpinesRockeries.name: aubrieta  Audrey Red
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained, preferably neutral or alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and  to keep the plants looking bushy, cut them back hard immediately after  flowering. This may also encourage a second, less prolific, flush of   flowers.

alpinesRockeries.name: grape hyacinth bulbs
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or light shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained soil (for container-grown bulbs use two parts John Innes No2 compost to one part sharp grit)
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Plant 10cm (4in) deep in naturalistic groups in autumn. During summer when the bulbs are dormant lift and divide groups that are becoming congested.

alpinesRockeries.name: dalmatian bellflower
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, well-drained, fertile soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Protect the tender foliage from slug damage using environmentally friendly slug pellets or beer traps. During the growing season water freely.

alpinesRockeries.name: feld pink
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: rich but well-drained, alkaline to neutral soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Dianthus should be trimmed back lightly after flowering to promote new basal growth.  Prune more closely in spring, as new shoots emerge to maintain a tidy shape. To maintain healthy growth, it is important to make sure the plants are protected from excessive winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: bugle
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  any moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: To rejuvenate and minimise congestion,  lift and divide clumps in late autumn or early spring every two years.

alpinesRockeries.name: Saxifraga Touran White
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun with a little shade during the hottest part of  the day
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: freely draining in winter, but able to hold some moisture  during the warmer months
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: lady's mantle
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:    full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  humus-rich soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back the faded flower heads and foliage in August and the plant will often produce a second flush of flowers. Alchemilla has a tendency to self-seedfreely, so to minimise the spread  of the plant remove the seedheads carefully after flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: American wake-robin bulbs
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:Plant rhizomes 5cm deep and 5cm apart in autumn.  Once planted they are best left undisturbed so they can build up their numbers.  Mulch in the autumn with a generous layer of leafmould.

alpinesRockeries.name: drumstick primrose
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Divide large clumps after the plant has  flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: pasque flower
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  fertile, well-drained soil (or equal parts of a loam-based potting compost such as John Innes No1 and grit for container-grown specimens)
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Plant very firmly in well-drained soil and take care when carrying out routine border maintenance since Pasque flowers resent having their roots disturbed.

alpinesRockeries.name: heron's bill
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: gritty, humus-rich, sharply-drained, neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogged conditions (particularly in winter), and divide congested colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: auricula
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil:  moist, humus-rich, neutral to acid soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Divide large clumps after the plant has flowered, preferably during a wet spell.

alpinesRockeries.name: woolly rock rose - Halimium libanotis
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately-fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: After flowering, pinch back young plant to encourage a bushy habit. Lightly trim or cut back any stems that spoil the symmetry of the plant. This plant should never be pruned hard.

alpinesRockeries.name: sowbread
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately-fertile, humus-rich, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care:
Bulb size: 13/15

Delicate pink flowers with upswept petals appear in winter or early spring above rounded, silvery-green leaves. These diminutive cyclamen are perfect for naturalising around the base of deciduous trees and shrubs. Best in humus-rich, well-drained soil in partial shade, they make excellent companions for ferns and other shade-loving plants.

alpinesRockeries.name: bloody cranesbill
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, well-drained, humus-rich, acid soil or ericaceous compost
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth:  average to fast growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: In midsummer rejuvenate plants that  are beginning to look jaded, by removing old flowered stems and leaves. Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: creeping phlox
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or lightly dappled shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, moist but freely draining soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Phlox are greedy plants, so apply a mulch 5-7cm (2-3in) deep, of well-rotted garden compost or manure in early spring.  Shear off the spent flower stems to prevent re-seeding. If the leaves show signs of powdery mildew, cut down to the ground and dispose of the affected foliage, but do not compost it.  Clear away the debris around the plant to reduce the chances of reinfection.  Lift and divide clumps in autumn and spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: hepatica
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, moist but well-drained neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Hepaticas resent being moved, so try to plant them where they can remain undisturbed for several years. Apply a generous layer of mulch in autumn or immediately after flowering.

alpinesRockeries.name: aubrieta Axcent Lilac
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, well-drained, preferably neutral or alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Avoid waterlogging, particularly in winter, and  to keep the plants looking bushy, cut them back hard immediately after  flowering. This may also encourage a second, less prolific, flush of   flowers.

alpinesRockeries.name: darley dale heath
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: During the growing season water regularly, applying a half-strength application of a balanced liquid fertiliser every four weeks. After the plant has flowered trim with shears or secateurs to remove the dead flowers and encourage bushy growth.

alpinesRockeries.name: Saxifraga Highlander Red
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun with a little shade during the hottest part of  the day
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: freely draining in winter, but able to hold some moisture  during the warmer months
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Cut back spreading species after flowering. Water moderately when actively growing and avoid winter wet.

alpinesRockeries.name: rock rose
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained neutral to alkaline soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden Care:  Prune in mid to late summer after flowering,  cutting back any straggly stems.

alpinesRockeries.name: phlox
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, fertile, moist, well-drained soil, including heavy soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Phlox are greedy plants, so apply a mulch 5-7cm (2-3in) deep, of well-rotted garden compost or manure in early spring.  Shear off the spent flower stems to prevent re-seeding. If the leaves show signs of powdery mildew, cut down to the ground and dispose of the affected foliage, but do not compost it.  Clear away the debris around the plant to reduce the chances of reinfection.  Lift and divide clumps in autumn and spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: bloody cranesbill
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth:  average to fast growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: In midsummer rejuvenate plants that  are beginning to look jaded, by removing old flowered stems and leaves. Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

alpinesRockeries.name: creeping phlox
alpinesRockeries.position: Position:  full sun or lightly dappled shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: humus-rich, moist but freely draining soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Give it a trim after the flowers have faded and  lift and divide clumps in autumn.

alpinesRockeries.name: sweet violet
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, humus-rich, moist, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.rateOfGrowth: Rate of growth: average to fast-growing
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care: Keep the seeds chilled until they can be sown. Early sowings can be done in a cold frame, into trays of good seed compost and gradually hardened off before planting out. Alternatively sow directly into a well-prepared seed bed. Gently thin the seedlings out to 15cm apart when they are large enough to handle.

alpinesRockeries.name: bleeding heart
alpinesRockeries.position: Position: full sun or partial shade
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: moist, humus-rich rich, preferably neutral to slightly alkaline
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:  Lift and divide large clumps in late autumn when the leaves have died down, or in early spring before the new growth appears, taking care not to damage the fragile roots.

alpinesRockeries.name: beach aster
alpinesRockeries.soil: Soil: fertile, well-drained soil
alpinesRockeries.care: Garden care:   Cut back to ground level  in autumn and avoid winter wet.
